meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily crumbled or broken into small fragments.
meanings.sent1: The friabilities of the cookie made it crumble with just a light touch.
meanings.sent2: The sand's friabilities made it perfect for building sandcastles at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The friabilities of the old book were so extreme that even a gentle breeze could turn its pages.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins showed signs of friabilities, as time had worn them down to mere specks of dust.
meanings.sent5: The friabilities of the dry leaves underfoot created a satisfying crunch with each step.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a substance to crumble or break apart easily.
meanings.sent1: The friabilities of the clay made it difficult to sculpt intricate details.
meanings.sent2: The friabilities of the rock made it unsafe for climbing without proper gear.
meanings.sent3: The friabilities of the bread were so extreme that cutting it neatly was nearly impossible.
meanings.sent4: The building's structure showed signs of friabilities, with cracks appearing in the walls.
meanings.sent5: The friabilities of the ice cream cone caused it to shatter upon hitting the ground.
